Key Match Events: Jazz Chisholm Jr.’s walk-off infield single in the 11th inning secured a 4-3 victory for the New York Yankees over the Kansas City Royals.
Juan Soto’s go-ahead home run in the sixth inning extended the Yankees’ lead in the AL East.
Salvador Perez made an impressive double play, and the Royals successfully challenged a safe call at first base.
Pre-Game Insights: The Orioles’ loss to Boston in extra innings allowed the Yankees to maintain their advantage in the AL East.
Post-Match Reflections: The Yankees’ victory solidified their position in the AL East, while the Royals fell further behind Cleveland in the AL Central but maintained their hold on the second wild card spot.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Due to Norton High School football coverage, Royals Baseball coverage on SuperStar Country 102.5 & 1530 AM will resume on Saturday.
